    biost561fp

    biost561fp.Rmd
    library(biost561fp)
library(GA)
#> Loading required package: foreach
#> Loading required package: iterators
#> Package 'GA' version 3.2.4
#> Type 'citation("GA")' for citing this R package in publications.
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'GA'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:utils':
#> 
#>     de

    Introduction The biost561fp package provides tools to solve the Traveling Salesperson Problem (TSP) using various heuristic methods. This vignette demonstrates how to generate a random distance matrix, solve the TSP using different algorithms, and compare the results.

    Generating a Random Distance Matrix First, we generate a random distance matrix using the generateRandomDistMatrix function. This matrix represents the distances between cities.

    # Set seed for reproducibility
set.seed(123)

# Number of cities
numCities <- 5

# Generate random distance matrix
distMatrix <- generateRandomDistMatrix(numCities)
print(distMatrix)
#>           [,1]      [,2]      [,3]      [,4]     [,5]
#> [1,]  0.000000  5.510093 95.726501 90.082672 89.06439
#> [2,]  5.510093  0.000000 45.880081 25.362686 69.58754
#> [3,] 95.726501 45.880081  0.000000  5.163894 64.41017
#> [4,] 90.082672 25.362686  5.163894  0.000000 99.43271
#> [5,] 89.064392 69.587537 64.410175 99.432708  0.00000

    Solving the TSP using Nearest Neighbor Algorithm Next, we solve the TSP using the nearest neighbor heuristic with the nearestNeighbor function.

    # Solve TSP using nearest neighbor algorithm
nn_result <- nearestNeighbor(distMatrix)
print(nn_result)
#> $tour
#> [1] 1 2 4 3 5 1
#> 
#> $distance
#> [1] 189.5112

    Solving the TSP using Genetic Algorithm We also solve the TSP using a genetic algorithm with the geneticAlgorithm function.

    # Solve TSP using genetic algorithm
ga_result <- geneticAlgorithm(distMatrix)
print(ga_result)
#> $tour
#> x1 x2 x3 x4 x5 x1 
#>  2  3  1  5  4  2 
#> 
#> $distance
#> [1] 1473.122

    Finding the Best Solution Finally, we find the best solution using the solveTSP function, which compares the results of the nearest neighbor and genetic algorithms and returns the best one.

    # Find the best solution using all methods
best_solution <- solveTSP(distMatrix)
print(best_solution)
#> $tour
#> [1] 1 2 4 3 5 1
#> 
#> $distance
#> [1] 189.5112

    Summary In this vignette, we demonstrated how to generate a random distance matrix, solve the TSP using the nearest neighbor and genetic algorithms, and find the best solution using the solveTSP function. The tspSolver package provides a simple and effective way to solve the Traveling Salesperson Problem using various heuristic methods. ```
